title: Soigne Ta Droite
description: “There is nothing that I love more than composing for and working with a large ensemble. Entr’acte is the most recent iteration of a process for me that’s developed over more than two decades. The band is comprised of an international cast of 10 musical characters who I believe represent the highest levels of the improviser’s art.” - Ken Vandermark

artist: Paul Lytton / Nate Wooley + Ikue Mori & Ken Vandermark
title: The Nows
description: "I absolutely adore this supergroup of performers." - claire rousay. Ikue Mori: Computer. Nate Wooley: Trumpet. Ken Vandermark: Sax. Paul Lytton: Percussion.

title: Underthru
description: "it is the most overtly jazz-based recording in the Morris catalog... Underthru swings and grooves and leaves a lot of space for interaction." -Larry Appelbaum, JazzTimes

title: Een Rondje Holland
description: "Rather than simply grafting cheesy strings to original songs, these Dutch noiseniks have bent a 20-piece orchestra to their own polyrhythmic, cacophonous needs. The result is pure sonic excess. Latinate brass fanfares slur, goaded by jagged slashing from cellos as the five members of The Ex raise a tumult. The music is a delirious pummeling, all energy and rhythm on cuts like "Kokend Asfalt" (which is a reworked "State of Shock" from "Scrabbling at the Lock" with cellist Tom Cora) or the Stravinsky-meets-Stooges "Meer Nieuws" (which alters "River," from "Dizzy Spells")." -Kevin Williams, Chicago Tribune

title: Disturbing Domestic Peace
description: "What makes them interesting, is their original musical approach, not hindered by technical ingenuity." Terrie (guitar), G.W. Sok (vocals), Bas (bass), Ome Geurt (drums). 1980.

title: Deep Fried
description: "Now this a strange one. I never would've thought I would be paired with Jaap Blonk... it seems an unlikely combination. But when Tijs van Trigt asked us to perform at his AMPsnacks event in Arnhem, we had such a blast that we decided to do some recording together. This cd is a selection of three hours of improvisation we recorded at STEIM in Amsterdam. Quite a rollercoaster I'd say!" - Rutger Zuydervelt. Jaap Blonk - electronics, voice; Rutger Zuydervelt - electronics, objects

artist: Anders Jormin, Christian Jormin & Mats Gustafsson
title: Opus Apus
description:
"This rare meeting has developed into this exciting CD ”Opus apus”. The title refers to that the
major part of the compositions have got titles from names of birds in Latin."

title: Polychoral
description: "This is such a gorgeous piece of music." - claire rousay. Nate Wooley: trumpet. Peter Evans: trumpet.

title: Underground Railroad + Live At Holy Cross Monastery
description: “This is Joe McPhee’s first album, recorded in 1969.  His stunning creative journey begins here and has continued without letup for half a century.” - Ken Vandermark. Joe McPhee- trumpet, tenor saxophone, alto horn. Reggie Marks- tenor saxophone, flute, organ. Otis Greene- alto saxophone, harmonica. Joe Virgillio- tenor & soprano saxophones. Tyrone Crabb- bass. Ernest Bostic- drums, percussion. 1969.

title: Burrum​​-​​bah
description: "Their interplay is so nuanced and quite often you may wonder where one idea began or finished as so much fascinating musical, intellectual, and emotional information is being exchanged at every given moment." - Eyal Hareuveni
